name: Chiang Mai
summary: Affordable digital nomad haven with ancient temples and night markets. Over 300 temples dot this walled city surrounded by misty mountains and lush jungle.

name: Siem Reap
summary: Gateway to the magnificent Angkor Wat temple complex, one of the most awe-inspiring archaeological sites on Earth. A small city with big temples and warm Khmer hospitality.

name: Luang Prabang
summary: UNESCO town where saffron-robed monks collect morning alms along the Mekong. A serene blend of French colonial architecture and gilded Buddhist temples.

name: Hoi An
summary: Lantern-lit ancient trading port with world-class tailors and pristine beaches nearby. This enchanting UNESCO town glows with thousands of silk lanterns each evening.

name: Da Nang
summary: Modern beach city bridging historic Hoi An and imperial Hue. A fast-growing coastal metropolis with golden bridges, marble mountains, and excellent seafood.

name: Hanoi
summary: Thousand-year-old capital where French colonial charm meets bustling street food culture. Wander the chaotic Old Quarter, sip egg coffee, and watch life unfold around Hoan Kiem Lake.

name: Penang
summary: Street food capital of Asia with colorful George Town heritage and hilltop temples. A melting pot of Malay, Chinese, Indian, and colonial British cultures on one island.

name: Langkawi
summary: Duty-free island paradise with mangrove cruises, cable cars, and eagle-watching. A laid-back archipelago of 99 islands where jungle-clad peaks meet turquoise Andaman waters.

name: Phuket
summary: Thailand's largest island offering luxury resorts, vibrant nightlife, and stunning Andaman beaches. From serene temple visits to lively Patong, Phuket serves every type of traveler.

name: Krabi
summary: Limestone karst paradise with world-famous island-hopping and rock climbing. Gateway to Railay Beach, the Phi Phi Islands, and some of Thailand's most dramatic scenery.

name: Koh Samui
summary: Tropical island blending palm-fringed beaches with wellness retreats and full moon parties nearby. From luxury hillside villas to backpacker bungalows, the island welcomes all.

name: Ubud
summary: Spiritual heart of Bali surrounded by rice terraces, yoga studios, and artisan workshops. A lush jungle retreat where ancient Hindu traditions meet modern wellness culture.

name: Yogyakarta
summary: Cultural soul of Java with ancient Borobudur and Prambanan temples. A vibrant student city blending Javanese royal traditions with contemporary art and batik workshops.

name: Bandung
summary: Cool highland city known for tea plantations, art deco architecture, and vibrant fashion. A creative hub surrounded by volcanic peaks and scenic countryside.

name: Cebu
summary: Island capital with Spanish colonial heritage and world-class diving nearby. A bustling city that serves as gateway to whale sharks, sardine runs, and pristine island beaches.

name: Boracay
summary: Tiny island famous for its powdery White Beach and spectacular sunsets. After a rehabilitation closure, this Philippine gem returned cleaner and more beautiful than ever.

name: Palawan
summary: Pristine archipelago with underground rivers, hidden lagoons, and crystal-clear waters. Repeatedly voted the world's best island, Palawan is nature at its most magnificent.

name: Vientiane
summary: Sleepy Mekong capital with golden stupas, French bakeries, and Buddhist serenity. One of Asia's most laid-back capitals where life moves at the pace of the river.

name: Phnom Penh
summary: Rapidly evolving capital blending Khmer heritage with a buzzing riverside cafe scene. From the sobering Killing Fields to glittering Royal Palace, this city tells Cambodia's full story.

name: Nha Trang
summary: Coastal resort city famous for pristine beaches, scuba diving, and mud baths. A Vietnamese Riviera where turquoise waters meet a lively waterfront promenade.

name: Dalat
summary: Cool highland retreat with French colonial villas, pine forests, and adventure sports. Vietnam's City of Eternal Spring offers waterfalls, flower gardens, and surprisingly great coffee.

name: Malacca
summary: UNESCO-listed historic trading port with unique Peranakan culture and legendary street food. Centuries of Portuguese, Dutch, and British rule created one of Southeast Asia's most culturally layered cities.

name: Ipoh
summary: Charming tin-mining town with stunning cave temples, colonial architecture, and famous white coffee. A delicious hidden gem experiencing a renaissance as Malaysia's next foodie destination.

name: Cameron Highlands
summary: Misty Malaysian hill station with rolling tea plantations and strawberry farms. A cool escape from tropical heat with colonial-era bungalows and mossy forest trails.

name: Lombok
summary: Bali's quieter neighbor with pristine beaches, Mount Rinjani volcano, and traditional Sasak villages. An unspoiled paradise offering world-class surf and the stunning Gili Islands.

name: Flores
summary: Wild eastern island home to Komodo dragons, volcanic lakes, and traditional villages. An adventurous destination where the tri-colored Kelimutu crater lakes change hues with the seasons.

name: Siargao
summary: Teardrop-shaped surfing paradise with laid-back island vibes and mangrove forests. Cloud 9's famous barrel wave draws surfers worldwide while lagoons and rock pools enchant everyone else.

name: Battambang
summary: Charming riverside town with French colonial architecture and bamboo train rides. Cambodia's best-kept secret offers Angkor-era temples, bat caves, and an emerging art scene.

name: Pai
summary: Bohemian mountain town with hot springs, waterfalls, and a thriving backpacker scene. A dreamy valley village where the vibe is mellow and the rice paddies are golden.

name: Koh Lanta
summary: Relaxed island with long beaches, mangroves, and Old Town fishing village charm. A family-friendly alternative to Phuket's party scene with spectacular sunsets over the Andaman.

name: Bagan
summary: Ancient city of 2000+ Buddhist temples and pagodas stretching across a vast dusty plain. Sunrise balloon rides over this temple-studded landscape create unforgettable memories.

name: Chiang Rai
summary: Northern Thai city home to the dazzling White Temple and vibrant hill tribe cultures. A cooler, quieter alternative to Chiang Mai with the stunning Golden Triangle nearby.

name: Fukuoka
summary: Gateway to Kyushu with legendary ramen, vibrant yatai street stalls, and beach culture. A modern city that perfectly balances urban energy with laid-back coastal vibes.

name: Sapporo
summary: Snow festival city offering world-class skiing, fresh seafood, and craft beer scene. Hokkaido's capital delivers powder snow in winter and lavender fields in summer.

name: Okinawa
summary: Subtropical island chain blending unique Ryukyu culture with pristine beaches. Japan's tropical paradise offers turquoise waters, coral reefs, and a laid-back pace of life.

name: Hiroshima
summary: Resilient city of peace with iconic memorial, incredible okonomiyaki, and nearby Miyajima island. A deeply moving destination that emerged from tragedy to become a beacon of hope.

name: Kanazawa
summary: Beautifully preserved Edo-era castle town with one of Japan's finest gardens. Kenroku-en Garden, geisha districts, and gold-leaf artisan culture make this a cultural treasure.

name: Nara
summary: Ancient capital where sacred deer roam freely among stunning 8th-century temples. Home to the world's largest bronze Buddha and some of Japan's oldest wooden structures.

name: Hakone
summary: Hot spring resort town with views of Mount Fuji, volcanic valleys, and open-air museums. A beloved weekend escape from Tokyo with steaming onsen, pirate ships, and mountain cable cars.

name: Kamakura
summary: Seaside town with Great Buddha statue, ancient temples, and excellent hiking trails. A coastal gem just an hour from Tokyo with surf beaches, zen temples, and forest walks.

name: Takayama
summary: Beautifully preserved mountain town famous for sake breweries and stunning festivals. Old merchant houses, morning markets, and Hida beef make this Alpine town irresistible.

name: Naoshima
summary: Tiny art island with world-renowned contemporary art museums set in stunning nature. Tadao Ando's architectural masterpieces dot this Inland Sea island where art and nature merge.

name: Beppu
summary: Steaming hot spring capital of Japan with eight distinct geothermal hells to explore. A surreal city where volcanic steam rises from streets, gardens, and mountainsides everywhere you look.

name: Jeju
summary: Volcanic island paradise with lava tubes, tangerine orchards, and female free-divers. South Korea's Hawaii boasts dramatic coastlines, waterfalls, and the volcanic Hallasan peak.

name: Gyeongju
summary: Open-air museum city with royal Silla dynasty tombs and ancient Buddhist temples. Thousand-year-old capital with grassy burial mounds, pagodas, and Korea's finest historical treasures.

name: Kaohsiung
summary: Harbor city with stunning arts district, night markets, and gateway to Kenting beaches. Taiwan's second city is an urban renewal success story with world-class public art.

name: Tainan
summary: Taiwan's oldest city packed with ornate temples, incredible street food, and rich history. The food capital of Taiwan where every alley hides another legendary snack or noodle shop.

name: Hualien
summary: Gateway to Taroko Gorge's marble canyons with indigenous culture and Pacific coast beauty. A dramatic meeting of mountains and ocean where marble-walled gorges take your breath away.

name: Macau
summary: Glittering casino city with Portuguese colonial heritage and legendary Cantonese cuisine. A unique East-meets-West enclave where ornate churches stand beside Chinese temples and mega-casinos.

name: Guilin
summary: Karst mountain paradise with the iconic Li River cruise and centuries of landscape paintings. The scenery that inspired a thousand Chinese paintings awaits with bamboo rafts and misty peaks.

name: Lijiang
summary: Ancient Naxi town beneath snow-capped Jade Dragon Mountain with UNESCO Old Town. Cobblestone canals wind through a charming old town backed by dramatic Himalayan peaks.

name: Kunming
summary: Spring City with year-round pleasant climate and gateway to Yunnan's incredible diversity. A relaxed capital surrounded by ethnic minority cultures, stone forests, and alpine lakes.

name: Xiamen
summary: Charming coastal city with car-free Gulangyu Island and vibrant Hokkien culture. A garden city on the sea with colonial architecture, temple incense, and incredible seafood.

name: Dali
summary: Bohemian lakeside town with Bai minority culture, marble mountains, and three pagodas. A backpacker favorite where ancient walls frame stunning Erhai Lake and Cangshan peaks.

name: Zhangjiajie
summary: Towering sandstone pillars that inspired Avatar's floating mountains in a stunning national park. Glass skywalks and the world's longest cable car add thrills to this surreal landscape.

name: Goa
summary: Beach paradise blending Portuguese colonial charm with psychedelic trance culture and seafood. From sunset yoga on the cliffs to all-night beach parties, Goa has been drawing travelers for decades.

name: Jaipur
summary: Pink City of magnificent forts, ornate palaces, and vibrant bazaars in Rajasthan. Every corner reveals intricate architecture, from Hawa Mahal's honeycomb facade to Amber Fort's grandeur.

name: Udaipur
summary: City of Lakes with floating palaces, romantic boat rides, and Rajasthani grandeur. Often called the Venice of the East, this royal city shimmers with lakeside palaces and hilltop temples.

name: Kathmandu
summary: Chaotic Himalayan capital with ancient stupas, prayer flags, and trekking base camps. A sensory whirlwind of incense, temple bells, and narrow alleys leading to hidden courtyards.

name: Pokhara
summary: Serene lakeside city with Annapurna views and gateway to world-famous Himalayan treks. Phewa Lake reflects snowcapped peaks while paragliders soar overhead in this adventure hub.

name: Colombo
summary: Coastal capital mixing colonial heritage with modern dining, temples, and tropical energy. A city reborn with rooftop bars, street food tours, and the iconic Galle Face Green promenade.

name: Galle
summary: Atmospheric fort city with Dutch colonial ramparts, boutique hotels, and Indian Ocean sunsets. UNESCO-listed walls enclose a charming grid of cafes, galleries, and colonial-era churches.

name: Kandy
summary: Hill country gem with the sacred Temple of the Tooth and lush botanical gardens. Sri Lanka's cultural capital sits amid misty mountains, tea estates, and sacred Buddhist heritage.

name: Ella
summary: Misty mountain village with dramatic train rides, tea plantations, and stunning hiking. The scenic railway journey to Ella through green hills and bridges is one of Asia's greatest train rides.

name: Pondicherry
summary: French colonial enclave with colorful streets, Sri Aurobindo ashram, and Tamil culture. Bougainvillea-draped streets in the French Quarter contrast with vibrant Tamil bazaars just blocks away.

name: Varanasi
summary: World's oldest living city with sacred Ganges ghats, evening fire ceremonies, and spiritual intensity. Life, death, and rebirth unfold along the holy river in humanity's most ancient pilgrimage city.

name: Hampi
summary: Surreal boulder-strewn landscape scattered with ruins of a once-mighty empire. The crumbling Vijayanagara capital sprawls among giant boulders beside a sacred river in otherworldly beauty.

name: Kochi
summary: Charming port city with Chinese fishing nets, spice markets, and Kerala backwater access. A cosmopolitan trading hub for centuries, now delighting visitors with its Biennale art scene.

name: Dubrovnik
summary: Walled Mediterranean jewel and Game of Thrones filming location perched above the Adriatic. Walk the ancient ramparts for breathtaking views of terracotta roofs and azure seas.

name: Kotor
summary: Dramatic fjord-like bay with Venetian old town and serpentine fortress walls. Climb 1,350 steps to the fortress for jaw-dropping views of Europe's southernmost fjord.

name: Hallstatt
summary: Fairy-tale lakeside village nestled in the Austrian Alps with ancient salt mines. This impossibly picturesque hamlet is so beautiful it was replicated in full in China.

name: Bruges
summary: Perfectly preserved medieval city of canals, chocolate shops, and Gothic architecture. Cobblestone lanes wind past gabled houses, craft beer pubs, and serene swan-filled canals.

name: Cinque Terre
summary: Five colorful clifftop fishing villages connected by hiking trails above the Italian Riviera. Car-free hamlets cascade down rugged coastal cliffs with vineyards and azure Mediterranean views.

name: Amalfi
summary: Dramatic coastal town on Italy's most famous stretch of Mediterranean coastline. A former maritime republic with a stunning cathedral, lemon groves, and winding cliffside roads.

name: Positano
summary: Pastel-colored vertical village cascading down cliffs to a pebble beach on the Amalfi Coast. Instagram's favorite Italian town delivers la dolce vita with style, glamour, and limoncello.

name: Lake Como
summary: Glamorous Alpine lake surrounded by palatial villas, gardens, and mountain trails. George Clooney's neighborhood features opulent Belle Epoque villas and stunning mountain-lake scenery.

name: Santorini
summary: Iconic white-washed caldera village with stunning sunsets and volcanic beaches. Blue-domed churches perch on dramatic cliffs above a flooded volcanic crater in this Cycladic dream.

name: Mykonos
summary: Glamorous Cycladic island known for windmills, beach clubs, and legendary nightlife. The cosmopolitan party island of the Mediterranean with dazzling white architecture and turquoise coves.

name: Crete
summary: Largest Greek island with Minoan palaces, dramatic gorges, and incredible cuisine. From the ancient ruins of Knossos to the stunning Samaria Gorge, Crete offers unmatched diversity.

name: Rhodes
summary: Medieval walled city with ancient history, beautiful beaches, and year-round sunshine. Knights of St. John left an incredible medieval town that rivals any Game of Thrones set.

name: Corfu
summary: Lush Venetian-influenced island with olive groves, crystal waters, and elegant architecture. A greener, more romantic Greek island with Italianate old town and Durrell family history.

name: Antalya
summary: Turkish Riviera hub with Roman ruins, pristine beaches, and dramatic Taurus Mountains. Ancient Aspendos theater and the old harbor Kaleici district anchor this sun-drenched coast.

name: Cappadocia
summary: Surreal fairy-chimney landscape famous for hot air balloon rides and cave hotels. Hundreds of colorful balloons floating over ancient rock formations create the world's most iconic sunrise.

name: Bodrum
summary: Aegean resort town with ancient Mausoleum ruins, white houses, and vibrant marina. A stylish Turkish Riviera destination where ancient history meets contemporary beach club culture.

name: Faro
summary: Algarve gateway with medieval old town and access to stunning cliff-lined beaches. A charming university city where the Ria Formosa lagoon meets golden Algarve coastline.

name: Sintra
summary: Romantic hilltop town with colorful fairy-tale palaces nestled in misty forests. Lord Byron called it a glorious Eden, and the whimsical Pena Palace proves him right.

name: San Sebastian
summary: Basque culinary capital with stunning La Concha beach and more Michelin stars per capita than Paris. A perfect pairing of world-class pintxos bars and one of Europe's best urban beaches.

name: Lucerne
summary: Storybook Swiss city with Chapel Bridge, lake cruises, and Mount Pilatus access. Medieval covered bridge, crystal-clear lake, and snow-capped peaks create a perfect Alpine postcard.

name: Interlaken
summary: Adventure capital between two Alpine lakes with paragliding, skiing, and Jungfrau views. The ultimate adrenaline hub where you can skydive, canyon, and bungee with Alpine peaks all around.

name: Colmar
summary: Fairy-tale Alsatian town with half-timbered houses and renowned white wine route. Pastel-colored medieval buildings line canals in a town that inspired Beauty and the Beast.

name: Lake Bled
summary: Postcard-perfect Alpine lake with island church, hilltop castle, and cream cake. A tiny emerald lake with a fairy-tale island and Julian Alps reflection that seems too perfect to be real.

name: Mostar
summary: Ottoman bridge town famous for dramatic cliff diving and East-meets-West heritage. The reconstructed Stari Most bridge spans emerald waters in a city rebuilding with grace and beauty.

name: Sibenik
summary: Medieval Dalmatian city with UNESCO cathedral and gateway to Krka waterfalls. A less-crowded Croatian gem with Game of Thrones connections and stunning national parks nearby.

name: Hvar
summary: Sun-soaked Dalmatian island with lavender fields, Renaissance architecture, and yacht scene. Croatia's sunniest island offers ancient walls, secluded coves, and sophisticated nightlife.

name: Cesky Krumlov
full_name: Cesky Krumlov, South Bohemia, Czech Republic
summary: Enchanting Bohemian town with Renaissance castle and meandering Vltava River. A perfectly preserved medieval town where you can kayak through the old center under castle towers.

name: Tromso
summary: Arctic gateway for Northern Lights, midnight sun, and Arctic Cathedral. The world's northernmost university city offers whale watching, dog sledding, and aurora borealis.

name: Lofoten
summary: Dramatic Arctic archipelago with fishing villages, Viking history, and midnight sun surfing. Red fishermen's cabins dot jagged peaks rising from Arctic waters in this otherworldly landscape.

name: Rovaniemi
summary: Official hometown of Santa Claus on the Arctic Circle with Northern Lights and reindeer safaris. Cross the Arctic Circle, meet Santa, and chase the aurora in Finland's winter wonderland.

name: Valletta
summary: Tiny Baroque fortress capital packed with knights' heritage and Mediterranean views. The EU's smallest capital city packs grand palaces, churches, and harbor views into a compact peninsula.

name: Batumi
summary: Black Sea resort city with botanical gardens, modern architecture, and Georgian hospitality. A surprising party city on the Black Sea with stunning architecture and legendary wine culture.

name: Petra
summary: Ancient Nabataean city carved into rose-red cliffs and one of the New Seven Wonders. Walking through the narrow Siq canyon to glimpse the Treasury facade is a bucket-list moment.

name: Wadi Rum
summary: Mars-like desert landscape with Bedouin camps, sandstone arches, and Lawrence of Arabia history. Sleep under the stars in a Bedouin tent amid towering red rock formations on Mars on Earth.

name: Aqaba
summary: Red Sea diving destination with coral reefs, desert excursions, and year-round warm waters. Jordan's beach town combines world-class scuba with desert canyons and historic port vibes.

name: Salalah
summary: Tropical Arabian city with monsoon-fed waterfalls, frankincense heritage, and pristine beaches. The only place on the Arabian Peninsula with a monsoon season that turns the desert green.

name: Marrakech
summary: Sensory overload of souks, riads, and the legendary Jemaa el-Fna square. Snake charmers, spice mountains, and the call to prayer create an unforgettable North African experience.

name: Fez
summary: World's largest car-free urban area with medieval medina and centuries-old tanneries. Getting lost in the 9,000 alleys of the ancient medina is both inevitable and magical.

name: Essaouira
summary: Windy Atlantic port town beloved by surfers, artists, and Game of Thrones fans. Blue fishing boats, whitewashed ramparts, and Hendrix-era bohemian spirit define this coastal gem.

name: Chefchaouen
summary: Mountain town painted entirely in shades of blue tucked into the Rif Mountains. Every alley, doorway, and staircase is drenched in blue, creating a dreamlike Moroccan village.

name: Tangier
summary: Gateway between Africa and Europe with a storied literary history and Mediterranean flair. Where the Mediterranean meets the Atlantic, this port city inspired Burroughs, Bowles, and Matisse.

name: Luxor
summary: Open-air museum city with Valley of the Kings, Karnak Temple, and pharaonic grandeur. The world's greatest open-air museum stretches along the Nile with temples and tombs spanning millennia.

name: Aswan
summary: Serene Nile city with Nubian culture, felucca sailing, and gateway to Abu Simbel. The most beautiful stretch of the Nile with colorful Nubian villages and ancient temples.

name: Zanzibar
summary: Spice island paradise with Stone Town heritage, turquoise waters, and dhow sailing. Carved wooden doors, spice plantations, and pristine beaches on this Indian Ocean island.

name: Livingstone
summary: Adventure capital at the edge of mighty Victoria Falls with rafting, bungee, and safaris. The smoke that thunders provides the backdrop for Africa's ultimate adventure playground.

name: Cartagena
summary: Colorful walled colonial city with Caribbean vibes, salsa dancing, and incredible ceviche. A UNESCO gem where bougainvillea-draped balconies and street musicians define the Caribbean experience.

name: Cusco
summary: Ancient Inca capital and gateway to Machu Picchu with cobblestone streets and altitude. Spanish colonial churches built atop Inca stone walls in this high-altitude cultural powerhouse.

name: Sacred Valley
summary: Stunning Andean valley with Inca ruins, weaving villages, and Machu Picchu rail access. Ancient agricultural terraces and traditional markets dot this breathtaking valley between Cusco and Machu Picchu.

name: Banos
full_name: Banos de Agua Santa, Tungurahua, Ecuador
summary: Adventure capital with waterfall routes, thermal baths, and swing at the end of the world. A tiny Andean town packed with adrenaline activities beneath the watchful eye of an active volcano.

name: Bariloche
full_name: San Carlos de Bariloche, Rio Negro, Argentina
summary: Patagonian lake district with chocolate shops, alpine scenery, and world-class skiing. Argentina's own Swiss Alps with glacial lakes, dense forests, and artisanal chocolate at every turn.

name: Mendoza
summary: Wine capital of South America with Malbec vineyards set against the Andes. Sip world-class wines with snow-capped Andean peaks as your backdrop in this sun-drenched valley.

name: La Paz
summary: World's highest capital with dramatic canyon setting, witches' market, and Death Road biking. A vertiginous city tumbling down a canyon at 3,640m with cable car transit and indigenous culture.

name: Sucre
summary: Bolivia's constitutional capital with gleaming white colonial architecture. The White City offers a gentler Bolivian pace with dinosaur footprints, markets, and gorgeous plazas.

name: Oaxaca
summary: Indigenous cultural capital with extraordinary cuisine, mezcal, and Day of the Dead traditions. A culinary pilgrimage destination where mole, tlayudas, and mezcal reach their highest form.

name: Playa del Carmen
full_name: Playa del Carmen, Quintana Roo, Mexico
summary: Caribbean beach town with European flair, cenote swimming, and Mayan ruin access. Fifth Avenue's buzzing promenade meets Caribbean turquoise in the Riviera Maya's cosmopolitan hub.

name: Tulum
summary: Bohemian beach town with clifftop Mayan ruins, cenotes, and stunning Caribbean turquoise. Where ancient Mayan ruins perch above powdery white sand and the jungle meets the sea.

name: San Miguel de Allende
full_name: San Miguel de Allende, Guanajuato, Mexico
summary: Baroque colonial jewel repeatedly voted world's best small city. Candy-colored facades, art galleries, and rooftop bars fill this perfectly preserved colonial town.

name: Antigua Guatemala
summary: Colonial gem surrounded by volcanoes with cobblestone streets and Spanish schools. Crumbling baroque churches and colorful ruins frame three majestic volcanic peaks in this UNESCO city.

name: Lake Atitlan
summary: Sacred Mayan lake ringed by volcanoes and traditional indigenous villages. Aldous Huxley called it the most beautiful lake in the world, and the ring of volcanoes proves him right.

name: Bocas del Toro
summary: Caribbean archipelago with laid-back surf culture, snorkeling, and jungle adventures. Wooden houses on stilts over turquoise waters on a chain of lush tropical islands.

name: Caye Caulker
summary: Tiny car-free island where the motto is go slow with incredible snorkeling on the reef. A barefoot Caribbean island where bikes and golf carts replace cars and the reef beckons just offshore.

name: San Juan
summary: Colorful colonial capital with El Morro fortress, salsa, and bioluminescent bays. Cobblestone streets of Old San Juan lead past pastel buildings to dramatic Atlantic fortifications.

name: Nassau
summary: Island capital with pink-sand beaches, pirate history, and crystal-clear Bahamian waters. From the colonial charm of downtown to the swimming pigs of Exuma, the Bahamas dazzles.

name: Bridgetown
summary: UNESCO-listed Caribbean capital with rum heritage, surf breaks, and tropical charm. Bajans welcome you to an island of flying fish, cricket, and the birthplace of rum punch.

name: Willemstad
summary: Dutch Caribbean gem with colorful Handelskade waterfront and world-class diving. Pastel-painted merchant houses line the harbor of this UNESCO World Heritage trading port.

name: Montego Bay
summary: Vibrant reggae city with white sand beaches, jerk cuisine, and Blue Mountain views. Doctor's Cave Beach and hip-strip nightlife make MoBay Jamaica's tourism capital.

name: Punta Cana
full_name: Punta Cana, La Altagracia, Dominican Republic
summary: All-inclusive beach paradise with palm-lined shores and championship golf. Miles of coconut-palm beaches and turquoise waters make this the Caribbean's most popular resort zone.

name: Queenstown
summary: Adventure capital of the world with bungee jumping, skiing, and stunning lake views. Every adrenaline activity imaginable set against the dramatic Remarkables mountain range.

name: Rotorua
full_name: Rotorua, Bay of Plenty, New Zealand
summary: Geothermal wonderland with Maori culture, boiling mud pools, and redwood forests. Steam rises from the streets of this extraordinary city where Maori heritage meets volcanic fury.

name: Wanaka
summary: Lakeside mountain town with that famous lone tree, hiking, and skiing. A quieter alternative to Queenstown with equally stunning scenery and a charming small-town feel.

name: Nadi
summary: Gateway to Fiji's islands with sugar cane fields and coral reef adventures. Your first taste of Fijian bula spirit before island-hopping to paradise.

name: Bora Bora
summary: Ultimate luxury island with overwater bungalows and impossibly turquoise lagoon. The Mount Otemanu backdrop and lagoon colors make this the ultimate honeymoon paradise.

name: Moorea
summary: Heart-shaped volcanic island with reef-ringed lagoons and pineapple plantations. Bora Bora's quieter sister offers equally stunning beauty with more accessible local Polynesian culture.

name: Rarotonga
summary: Tiny Pacific gem with Polynesian culture, lagoon snorkeling, and jungle treks. A volcanic island encircled by a turquoise lagoon where ancient Polynesian culture thrives.

name: Samarkand
summary: Silk Road jewel with turquoise-tiled madrasas and the magnificent Registan Square. Tamerlane's ancient capital dazzles with some of the Islamic world's most spectacular architecture.

name: Bukhara
summary: Ancient Silk Road trading center with 2,500 years of continuous urban history. Minarets, madrasas, and merchant domes create an open-air museum of Islamic architecture.

name: Maldives
summary: Paradise archipelago of 1,200 coral islands with overwater villas and underwater restaurants. The ultimate tropical escape where turquoise lagoons and white sand atolls stretch to the horizon.

name: Luang Namtha
summary: Remote northern Lao town surrounded by pristine jungle and ethnic minority villages. A trekking base for encountering traditional hill tribe cultures in untouched mountain forests.

name: Ninh Binh
summary: Stunning karst landscape known as the inland Ha Long Bay with river caves and ancient temples. Emerald rice paddies punctuated by limestone towers create Vietnam's most photogenic landscape.

name: Sapa
summary: Misty mountain town with cascading rice terraces and colorful Hmong hill tribe markets. Trek through some of Asia's most dramatic rice terraces while staying with local ethnic minority families.

name: Kota Kinabalu
summary: Gateway to Mount Kinabalu and Borneo's incredible wildlife with stunning island sunsets. Climb Southeast Asia's highest peak, dive world-class reefs, and spot orangutans in the wild.

name: Pakse
summary: Southern Lao gateway to the Bolaven Plateau's waterfalls and 4,000 Islands region. Coffee plantations, thundering cascades, and the serene Mekong Islands await in laid-back southern Laos.

name: Savannakhet
summary: Sleepy Mekong town with crumbling French colonial architecture and dinosaur museum. A charming crossroads town where faded colonial grandeur meets authentic Lao daily life.

name: Seminyak
summary: Bali's stylish beach district with upscale boutiques, beach clubs, and world-class dining. Sunset cocktails, designer shops, and some of Bali's best restaurants line this trendy coastal strip.

name: Nagano
summary: Mountain city famous for snow monkeys, 1998 Winter Olympics, and stunning Buddhist temples. Watch Japanese macaques soak in hot springs surrounded by snow in this charming alpine city.

name: Matsumoto
summary: Castle town with one of Japan's most beautiful original keeps and gateway to the Japanese Alps. A cultured city where a striking black-and-white castle guards the entrance to Alpine trails.

name: Jiufen
summary: Atmospheric hillside tea town that inspired Spirited Away's fantastical scenery. Lantern-lit alleyways cascade down a mountainside offering tea houses, ocean views, and gold mining history.

name: Muang Ngoi
summary: Tiny riverside village accessible only by boat with stunning karst scenery and zero traffic. One of Southeast Asia's last unplugged paradises where electricity arrived just years ago.
